content.heading: Introduction
content.body: The **Delhi Police Recruitment 2025** has been announced by SSC, bringing new opportunities for aspirants aiming for a stable government job in law enforcement. The selection process is tough, but with the right strategy, candidates can succeed. This article explains the exam pattern, syllabus, physical standards, and preparation tips in detail.

content.heading: Exam Pattern Overview
content.body: The selection process includes four important stages. Below is a quick overview of the complete exam scheme:

content.heading: Computer Based Examination (CBE)
content.body: The **CBE** is the first and most important stage. It is of **90 minutes** duration, containing **100 questions** for **100 marks**. The exam is bilingual (**Hindi & English**) with **negative marking of 0.25** for each wrong answer.

content.heading: Syllabus Details
content.body:
The syllabus covers multiple areas:

- **General Awareness**: Current Affairs, Indian History, Constitution, Polity, Economy, Culture, Geography.
- **Quantitative Aptitude**: Percentages, Ratio, Profit & Loss, Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry, Data Interpretation.
- **General Intelligence**: Coding-Decoding, Series, Puzzles, Decision Making, Venn Diagrams.
- **English**: Grammar, Comprehension, Synonyms, Antonyms, Idioms, Sentence Improvement.
- **Computer Fundamentals**: MS Word, MS Excel, PowerPoint, Email, Internet & Browsers.

content.heading: Physical Measurement Test (PMT)
content.body: PMT checks **Height** and **Chest** (for males) and **Height** (for females). Relaxation is given for **SC/ST candidates** and residents of hill areas.

content.heading: Typing Test on Computer

content.heading: Computer Formatting Test
content.body:
This is **qualifying only**, but candidates must demonstrate skills in **MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and MS Excel**. Key tasks include:

- Paragraph alignment, bullets, numbering, headers & footers.
- Creating slides with charts, images, hyperlinks.
- Excel functions, formulas, sorting, and formatting cells.

content.heading: Medical Standards
content.body: Candidates must be medically fit with **6/12 vision (with or without glasses)**. They should be free from deformities or diseases. PwBD candidates are allowed only under prescribed conditions.

content.heading: Preparation Tips
content.body:
Here are some important preparation strategies:

- **Academics**: Revise NCERTs for GK, practice mock tests for maths and reasoning.
- **Current Affairs**: Read newspapers daily and use monthly magazines.
- **Fitness**: Run daily, practice jumps, and build stamina.
- **Typing**: Practice 30 minutes daily on both Hindi and English.
- **Computer Skills**: Work on Word, Excel, and PowerPoint regularly.

Tip: Focus on weak areas early and maintain consistency.

content.heading: Conclusion
content.body: The **Delhi Police Recruitment 2025** is a golden opportunity for aspirants. With proper planning, regular fitness training, and focused study, candidates can crack the exam.
